p: While climate change is most commonly discussed as a threat to the environment, it also has significant implications for national security and human rights. Indeed, security-oriented discussions about climate change were brought up in the 2015 U.S. Department of Defense report on climate change [ 22]. Additionally, the 2015 White House National Security Strategy identifies climate change as a threat to national security [ 23]. This suggests that climate change may compete for prominence with other high-salience issues, such as terrorism and economic policy.
